title: Recording Arguments With Your Spouse - Suffolk County Divorce
description: 13-01-2013 The general answer in NY is that you may record conversations in which you are a participant but cannot secretly record conversations where your presence is unknown. So a spouse may have a recorder in their pocket when arguing with the other party. They cannot secretly record phone calls that they are not on the phone to participate in.

description: If you are recorded without your consent, the recording cannot be used in court, but she can testify as to what you said. This sounds like a lot about nothing. description: 26-01-2016 Is it legal to record your spouse on a phone call without their knowledge? Under the Texas penal code, it is a crime to intercept or record any wire, oral, or electronic communication. Tex. Penal Code  16.02, and Tex. Civ. Prac. & Rem.
